thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Thursday, 22 Feb 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Fidelity prevails at 1st Circuit in stable value fund lawsuit

author: Dena Aubin
title: Fidelity prevails at 1st Circuit in stable value fund lawsuit
text:
Fidelity Management Trust Co did not breach its duties to investors by choosing overly conservative investments for a stable value fund used in many 401(k) plans, a federal appeals court ruled on Wednesday.
A unanimous three-judge panel of the 1st U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals said it found no evidence that Boston-based Fidelity behaved disloyally toward stable fund investors, affirming a judgment in Fidelityâ€™s favor last year by a lower court.
To read the full story on Westlaw Practitioner Insights, click here: bit.ly/2HDhGg5
